Description: Body sherd of East Greek grey ware pottery closed vessel; exterior: dark grey; much fine silver mica; part of inscription incised on exterior; possibly burnt.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 698, no. 562)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 54, no. 40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.662)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
